intro: Monanthotaxis trichantha, commonly known as the hairy leaf cycad, is a unique cycad species native to the tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its stout, unbranched trunk and a crown of large, pinnately compound leaves that are covered in fine, hairy structures. The plant produces cones rather than flowers, with male and female cones occurring on separate plants. Its leaves are typically dark green and can grow quite long, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its slow growth and specific habitat requirements, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
